numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A person can be an applicant.
2. An applicant can be admitted to a prestigious institution.
3. I noticed a likelihood.
4. The likelihood of being admitted to a prestigious institution increases with the income of an applicant.
5. Some applicant is poor.
6. Some other applicant is richer than the poor applicant.
7. The odds that the richer applicant is admitted are about four times higher than the odds that the poor applicant is admitted.
8. I wonder about a reason for this difference.
9. Some richer applicant can pay tuition quickly.
10. Some poorer applicant takes out a loan.
11. I ask whether colleges admit richer applicants because richer applicants can pay tuition more quickly than applicants who take out loans.
12. I ask whether colleges consider richer applicants more reliable than applicants who take out loans.
13. This situation relates to me.
14. This situation relates to my community.
15. Many of my friends apply to colleges.
16. I apply to colleges.
17. There are more factors for being accepted to a college than we thought.
18. Many of us have to take out a loan.
19. Taking out a loan may affect the acceptance of an applicant.
20. The headline is: Money over Intelligence when it comes to college acceptance?
